etymologies: late 19th century. From ancient Greek ῥύσις flow, stream (from an ablaut variant of the base of ῥεῖν to flow + -σις) + -meter

definitions: An instrument for measuring the speed of flow of water or the speed of a ship through water, comprising an open-ended tube positioned in opposition to the flow and connected to a column of mercury or other liquid, which is raised by the pressure of the water.
